page.title: 07THE TOWN LANDS
page.content: The town lands of Selkirrk were granted to the Royal Burgh by Charter. In the past it was necessary to patrol your boundaries to ensurre that the the boundary markers had not been moved. Some of these lands still belong to the town and are tennanted by the present residents. Recent attempts to sell off the lands caused considerable bad feeling in the town and the attempt was abandonded. Instead improvements were made to increase the productivity of the farms and thus improve the returns for the town on this asset. The profits from the farms go into the Common Good Fund which is used for projects within the town for which there is no other funding.
